docs.text:
Overview


This document defines a set of cloud APIs that can be used by third-party services to access and control Sengled smart lighting devices via cloud-to-cloud integration. Access to the API endpoints requires a third-party service to authenticate itself using the standard OAuth2.0 authentication mechanism. Once a third-party service has successfully obtained an access token, it will authenticate all calls to any API endpoint by including the encoded access token in the Authorization header. 


Please see the detail of OAuth2 process in the diagram below.




Here is the URL form used in Step 3:


https://openapi.cloud.sengled.com/oauth2/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=testclient&redirect_uri= thirdpartner_url &scope=read&state=example


The response returned in Step 4 includes:


http://thirdpartner_url?code=b8ddea14-bad3-4181-b978-85c8ab9b9f44


An example of URL form used in Step 5 and Step 6 is as follows:


HTTP Request


Method
: POST


URL
: https://openapi.cloud.sengled.com/oauth2/token


Headers
: {Authorization=[Basic dGVzdGNsaWVudDoyY2M3YTBiOS0yOGEzLTQ2NGMtYTAwMC02Nzg1YTRlMTI5OWE=], Content-Type=[application/x-www-form-urlencoded]}


Body
: {grant_type=[authorization_code], redirect_uri=[http:// thirdpartner_url], code=[0c4a4615-3ae0-499b-802d-d43474cf2dd1]}


HTTP Response Headers


Status
: 200


Headers
:{Date=[Fri, 16 Oct 2015 08:26:34 GMT], Transfer-Encoding=[chunked], Content-Type=[application/json], Server=[Apache-Coyote/1.1], Pragma=[no-cache], Cache-Control=[no-store, no-transform]}


HTTP Response Body


{"access_token":"eyJhbGciOiJIUIkpXVCJ9.eyJjIjoiQVQmVCIsyODgoxOjc1OTUiLkIn0.PviXvjkSUbMvYaABFFNoSUCYU", "token_type": "bearer", "refresh_token": "eyJhcCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJjIjoiQVQwIjoCJqdMy0wYjEyNOiJhdHRfYNgK1sdr20.OjZCFqoFaU1bAM", "expires_in": 86399, "c": "AT&T", "jti": "debug-bj1:7595"}
docs.title: Overview

docs.text: This document defines a set of cloud APIs that can be used by third-party services to access and control Sengled smart lighting devices via cloud-to-cloud integration. Access to the API endpoints requires a third-party service to authenticate itself using the standard OAuth2.0 authentication mechanism. Once a third-party service has successfully obtained an access token, it will authenticate all calls to any API endpoint by including the encoded access token in the Authorization header.   Please see the detail of OAuth2 process in the diagram below.   Here is the URL form used in Step 3:  https://openapi.cloud.sengled.com/oauth2/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=testclient&redirect_uri= thirdpartner_url &scope=read&state=example  The response returned in Step 4 includes:  http://thirdpartner_url?code=b8ddea14-bad3-4181-b978-85c8ab9b9f44  An example of URL form used in Step 5 and Step 6 is as follows:  HTTP Request  Method : POST  URL : https://openapi.cloud.sengled.com/oauth2/token  Headers : {Authorization=[Basic dGVzdGNsaWVudDoyY2M3YTBiOS0yOGEzLTQ2NGMtYTAwMC02Nzg1YTRlMTI5OWE=], Content-Type=[application/x-www-form-urlencoded]}  Body : {grant_type=[authorization_code], redirect_uri=[http:// thirdpartner_url], code=[0c4a4615-3ae0-499b-802d-d43474cf2dd1]}  HTTP Response Headers  Status : 200  Headers :{Date=[Fri, 16 Oct 2015 08:26:34 GMT], Transfer-Encoding=[chunked], Content-Type=[application/json], Server=[Apache-Coyote/1.1], Pragma=[no-cache], Cache-Control=[no-store, no-transform]}  HTTP Response Body  {"access_token":"eyJhbGciOiJIUIkpXVCJ9.eyJjIjoiQVQmVCIsyODgoxOjc1OTUiLkIn0.PviXvjkSUbMvYaABFFNoSUCYU", "token_type": "bearer", "refresh_token": "eyJhcCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJjIjoiQVQwIjoCJqdMy0wYjEyNOiJhdHRfYNgK1sdr20.OjZCFqoFaU1bAM", "expires_in": 86399, "c": "AT&T", "jti": "debug-bj1:7595"}
docs.title: Overview

docs.text:
RESPONSE


Response status Code


Responses from Sengled cloud will include HTTP status code and OpenAPI status code. OpenAPI status code supplements HTTP status code by providing more status details and/or more targeted error messages associated with specific product type. 


HTTP Status code








HTTP Code


Description










200


OK






400


Bad Request. The request is not properly formatted.






401


Unauthorized. API authentication failed.






403


Forbidden, No valid access-token on request.






404


The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI.






405


A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource (e.g.,using PUT on a REST resource that only supports POST).








Sengled Open API Status Code


Below is status code value description.


200:    Success


<200:   General errors


>200:  Error codes for Specific Sengled product module 


Return status data format
：


{"code":200,"message":"success"}


General OpenAPI code list
：








Code


Description










200


OK






100


Invalid or missing required parameter.






101


Operation failed.






102


Operation not supported.






103


No Permission






104


Invalid or expired access token






105


One or more device(s) doesn’t exist.






106


Other








Openapi error code list specific for Sengled Element module
：








Code


Description










20602


hub offline






20604


Sengled bulb does not exist






20608


Bulb configuration failure






20610


is not paid service user






20007


Bulb offline








Device data object


The profile and settings of a Sengled smart device is represented as a data structure using the standard JSON format as follows.


{


"deviceList": [                             //bulb list


​       {


​         "propertyList": [


​           {


​             "property": "name",


​             "value": "ElementBulb007E"       //bulb name


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "brightness",


​             "value": "47"                    //bulb brightness:range(0-100)


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "switch",


​             "value": "on/off"                    //bulb power status


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "isOnline",


​             "value": "true"                  //bulb online status 


​           },


​           {


​             "property": "startTime",             //device activation time. 


​             "value": "2015-11-05 08:15:30"


​           }


​         ],


​         "product": "element",              //product type   


​         "deviceType": "",


​         "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",      //device MAC address  


​       }


​     ]


​   }


Device data object parameters
:








Name


Type


Description










deviceList


List


List of device data object






Property/value


{String/String}


Parameter name and value






product


String


Product type（element…）






deviceID


String


Device’s unique identifier








propertyList values
：








Name


Type


Supported product type


Description










name


String


All


Device name






brightness


String


All


Dim level（0-100）






colorTemperature


String


Element


Color temperature（0-100）






Switch


String


All


Light switch status on/off






Power


String


Element


Wattage






isOnline


String


All


Online status: true/false






startTime


String


All


UTC time at which a device is first activated.






parentDeviceID


String


Element


Hub id






deviceType


String


Element


Sub type of element






volume


String


Flex


The volume of speaker
docs.title: Response

OpenAPI status code supplements HTTP status code by providing more status details and/or more targeted error messages associated with specific product type.   HTTP Status code     HTTP Code  Description      200  OK    400  Bad Request. The request is not properly formatted.    401  Unauthorized. API authentication failed.    403  Forbidden, No valid access-token on request.    404  The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI.    405  A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource (e.g.,using PUT on a REST resource that only supports POST).     Sengled Open API Status Code  Below is status code value description.  200:    Success  <200:   General errors  >200:  Error codes for Specific Sengled product module   Return status data format ：  {"code":200,"message":"success"}  General OpenAPI code list ：     Code  Description      200  OK    100  Invalid or missing required parameter.    101  Operation failed.    102  Operation not supported.    103  No Permission    104  Invalid or expired access token    105  One or more device(s) doesn’t exist.    106  Other     Openapi error code list specific for Sengled Element module ：     Code  Description      20602  hub offline    20604  Sengled bulb does not exist    20608  Bulb configuration failure    20610  is not paid service user    20007  Bulb offline     Device data object  The profile and settings of a Sengled smart device is represented as a data structure using the standard JSON format as follows.  {  "deviceList": [                             //bulb list  ​       {  ​         "propertyList": [  ​           {  ​             "property": "name",  ​             "value": "ElementBulb007E"       //bulb name  ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "brightness",  ​             "value": "47"                    //bulb brightness:range(0-100)  ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "switch",  ​             "value": "on/off"                    //bulb power status  ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "isOnline",  ​             "value": "true"                  //bulb online status   ​           },  ​           {  ​             "property": "startTime",             //device activation time.   ​             "value": "2015-11-05 08:15:30"  ​           }  ​         ],  ​         "product": "element",              //product type     ​         "deviceType": "",  ​         "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",      //device MAC address    ​       }  ​     ]  ​   }  Device data object parameters :     Name  Type  Description      deviceList  List  List of device data object    Property/value  {String/String}  Parameter name and value    product  String  Product type（element…）    deviceID  String  Device’s unique identifier     propertyList values ：     Name  Type  Supported product type  Description      name  String  All  Device name    brightness  String  All  Dim level（0-100）    colorTemperature  String  Element  Color temperature（0-100）    Switch  String  All  Light switch status on/off    Power  String  Element  Wattage    isOnline  String  All  Online status: true/false    startTime  String  All  UTC time at which a device is first activated.    parentDeviceID  String  Element  Hub id    deviceType  String  Element  Sub type of element    volume  String  Flex  The volume of speaker
docs.title: RESPONSE

docs.text:
OpenAPI Endpoint Description


·queryAll


Retrieve a complete list of Sengled devices and their parameter values belonging to the authenticated Sengled user account.


GET
 https://openapi-router.cloud.sengled.com/
openapi/api/v1/queryAll


Input parameters


None


Response


If success, a list of devices and their parameter values will be returned as a JSON device data object mentioned above. If failed, a JSON status code will issued as follows. 


Example: {“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."} 








Parameter name


Type


Description










code


String


See Status code list for detailed code






message


String


Detailed status message








·query


Query for device parameter values of a specified set of devices. 


POST
 https://openapi-router.cloud.sengled.com
/openapi/api/v1/query


Input parameters


A list of device’s product type and MAC address.


{   


​    "devices": [


​        {


​           " product ": "element",


​            " deviceID ": " B0:CE:18:08:00:01"


​        }


​    ]


}








Name


Description


Type


Required










deviceID


Device unique identifier


String


Yes






product


Product type


String


Yes








Response


If success, a list of devices and their parameter values will be returned as a JSON device data object mentioned above. If failed, a JSON status code will be issued as follows. 


Example: {“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}








Parameter name


Type


Description










code


String


See Status code list for detailed code






message


String


Detailed status message








·control


Adjust specified parameter settings for the specified device. 


POST
 https://openapi-router.cloud.sengled.com/openapi/api/v1/control


Input parameters


{


​    "product": "element",


​    "deviceID": "deviceID",


​    "propertyList": [


​        {


​            "property": "brightness",


​            "value": "0-100"


​        }


​    ]


}


Supported property names：








Name


Description


Supported product


Required


Data type


Valid values










deviceID


Device Unique ID


ALL


Yes


String


MAC address






Product


Product Type


All


Yes


String


element, …






switch


Switch On/off state


ALL


No


String


off/on






brightness


Dim level


ALL


No


String


0-100






colorTemperature


Color temperature


Element


No


String


0-100






volume


The volume of speaker


Flex


No


String


0-100






speaker


The state of speaker:play,pause,stop


Flex


No


String


start/pause/stop






rgbColorR


Rgb red


element


No


String


0-255






rgbColorG


Rgb green


Element


No


String


0-255






rgbColorB


Rgb blue


Element


No


String


0-255








Response status


If all the parameters are adjusted correctly, a success status code will be issued as follows.


{“code":”200”,"message":"success"}


Otherwise, an example of the following error code will be returned.


{“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}








Parameter name


Type


Description










code


String


See Status code list for detailed code






message


String


Detailed status message








·groupControl


Adjust specified parameter settings for the specified device. 


POST
 https://openapi-router.cloud.sengled.com/openapi/api/v1/groupControl


Input parameters


{


"devices":[


{


"product": "element",


​    "deviceUuid": "deviceUuid"


}


],


​    "propertyList": [


​        {


​            "property": "brightness",


​            "value": "0-100"


​        }


​    ]


}


Supported property names：








Name


Description


Supported product


Required


Data type


Valid values










deviceUuid


Device Unique ID


ALL


Yes


String


MAC address






Product


Product Type


All


Yes


String


element, …






switch


Switch On/off state


ALL


No


String


off/on






brightness


Dim level


ALL


No


String


0-100






colorTemperature


Color temperature


Element


No


String


0-100






rgbColorR


Rgb red


element


No


String


0-255






rgbColorG


Rgb green


Element


No


String


0-255






rgbColorB


Rgb blue


Element


No


String


0-255








Response status


If all the parameters are adjusted correctly, a success status code will be issued as follows.


{“code":”200”,"message":"success"}


a Partial success status code will be issued as follows.


{


"code":"201",


"message":"Partial success",


Failures:[


{


"product":"element",


"deviceUuid":"deviceUuid"


}


]


} 


Otherwise, an example of the following error code will be returned.


{“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}








Parameter name


Type


Description










code


String


See Status code list for detailed code






message


String


Detailed status message






failures


List










·register


Allows third party services to register for callback service that provides asynchronous device parameter changes and/or events.


POST
 https://openapi-router.cloud.sengled.com
/openapi/api/v1/register


Input parameters


{


​    "registerUrl": " https://callback_url",


​    "username": "callback username",


​    "password": "callback password"


}








Name


Description


Required


Data type










registerUrl


Callback URL


Yes


String






username


Callback username


No


String






password


Callback password


No


String








Response status


If registration is successful, a success status code will be issued as follows.


{“code":”200”,"message":"success"}


Otherwise, an example of the following error code will be returned.


{“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}








Parameter name


Type


Description










code


String


See Status code list for detailed code






message


String


Detailed status message








·unregister


Allows third party services to unregister from callback service.


POST
 https://openapi-router.cloud.sengled.com
/openapi/api/v1/unregister


Input parameters


None


Response status


If de-registration is successful, a success status code will be issued as follows.


{“code":”200”,"message":"success"}


Otherwise, an example of the following error code will be returned.


{“code":”100”,"message":" Invalid or missing required parameter."}








Parameter name


Type


Description










code


String


See Status code list for detailed code






message


String


Detailed status message








·Call third party URL


Sengled API service will call third party URL with status changes or events.


POST
 " registerUrl "  


Input parameters


Http hearder: Authorization Header (HTTP Basic Authentication)


Basic encodeBase64("username "+":"+" password ")


Payload:


{


​    "propertyChangeList": [


{


"deviceID": "B0CE181400000333",


​           "product": "element",


​           "status": "online"


​        },


​        {


"deviceID": "B0CE181400000333",


​           "product": "element",


​           " status ": "offline"


​        },


​               {


​                       "product": "element",


​                       "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",


​                       "name": "B0CE18140aaaaaa"


​                },


​               {


​                       "product": "element",


​                       "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",


​                        "switch": "on"


​                },


​                {


​                       "product": " element ",


​                       "deviceID": "B0CE18140000007E",


​                       " brightness ":"20"


​                }


​           ] 


"devices:"[


​        {


​            "product": "element",


​            "deviceID": "B0CE181400000223",


​            "parentDeviceID": "",


​            "brightness": "15",


​                "switch": "on"


"colorTemperature": "15",


"power": "15",


​            "name": "Dave's bulb",


​            "action": "added"


​        },


​        {


​            "product": "element",


​            "deviceID": "B0CE181400000223",


​            "parentDeviceID": "",


​            "action": "deleted"


​        }


​    ]


}








Name


Description


Product supported


Required


Data type


Valid values










deviceID


Device Unique ID


All


Yes


String


MAC address






product


Product Type


All


Yes


String


element, …






name


Device nickname


All


Yes


String








switch


Switch On/off state


ALL


No


String


off/on






brightness


Dim level


ALL


No


String


0-100






colorTemperature


Color temperature


Element


No


String


0-100






eventName


Device event name


All


No


String


Online/offline/Add/delete






eventTime


Event time


All


No


String


UTC time








Response status


None


·ping


This endpoint allows a third-party service to check the health of the Sengled OpenAPI interface.


POST
 https://openapi-router.cloud.sengled.com/openapi/att/api/v1/ping 


Response


True

String     switch  Switch On/off state  ALL  No  String  off/on    brightness  Dim level  ALL  No  String  0-100    colorTemperature  Color temperature  Element  No  String  0-100    eventName  Device event name  All  No  String  Online/offline/Add/delete    eventTime  Event time  All  No  String  UTC time     Response status  None
